fields.headline: Full profile
fields.bodyText: Ben Trott has written and edited for a range of publications. Most recently, he was on the editorial board of the eight volume International Encyclopedia of Revolution and Protest (Wiley-Blackwell, 2009). In 2005, he co-edited Shut Them Down!, a book on the protests against the G8 Summit in Gleneagles, and in 2007 a special issue of a journal on 'immaterial' and 'affective' labour. For Red Pepper magazine, he blogged on the meaning of Barack Obama's presidential candidacy for the global left. He is an editor of the social movement journal Turbulence: Ideas for Movement, as well as WorkingUSA: The Journal of Labor and Society. He is completing a PhD in political philosophy in Berlin.
